dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5352 IH: To prohibit Federal funding for entities that employ individuals who condone and celebrate political violence and domestic terrorism, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Van Orden introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To prohibit Federal funding for entities that employ individuals who condone and celebrate political violence and domestic terrorism, and for other purposes.

section.header: Prohibiting Federal funding for entities that employ individuals who condone and celebrate political violence and domestic terrorism
section.text: No Federal funds may be obligated, expended, or otherwise disbursed to any entity that employ individuals who condone and celebrate political violence and domestic terrorism (as that term is defined in section 2331 of title 18, United States Code).
